description.narrative:
I. Establishment of three demonstration farms, showcasing Dutch technologies in Indonesia. CBIB farm certificates were awarded to the demo farms which opened new and better markets for their products. YY Tilapia genetics from the Netherlands have been imported into Indonesia allowing for continuous and independent high productive and naturally male (hormone free!) broodstock and fingerling supply for the Indonesian market.
II. Executing training programs and technical advice for Indonesian fish farmers and hatchery managers. In total 12 Master Tainers and 332 fish breeders and farmers were trained and inspired to adopt Dutch innovative and high quality solutions.
III. Improve access to markets: Established partnerships with offtakers and logistic providers. New farm data collection tools were introduced, enabling remote monitoring and traceability of fish production. New partnerships with Indonesian offtakers were established, valuing food safety and sustainable Dutch production methods of the demo farms.
IV. Dissemination of results to international and Indonesian stakeholders.
Indonesian fish breeders and farmers in West Java and East Java. Focus on catfish, pangasius and tilapia.

The objective of FishTechIndonesia was to contribute to a more competitive and sustainable aquaculture sector in Indonesia, enable relevant actors to improve productivity and food security whilst limiting the impact on the environment These goals have been achieved through demonstration, training and improvement of access to end markets.
